More than 100 Lake County residents have been infected with the virus each day for the last three days, a statistic we haven’t seen since May.

Simply put, too many have been cheating and IDPH is putting us on warning. Tell your neighbors: follow the three W’s: wash your hands, watch your distance and wear a mask. It will save lives and return us to safer levels of spread. 

https://t.co/ZF3XfEB0qf

The House passed the Heroes Act five months ago to provide desperately needed relief to working families, business owners, health care and essential workers, and state and local governments, only to hear crickets from Senator Mitch McConnell.

He’s offered no solutions to defeating this virus and no solutions to getting the over 800,000 newly jobless back to work, nor the millions who have lost their jobs since March. We need expanded contact tracing and testing. We need small business assistance. We need relief!

The United States has hit its highest daily coronavirus rate in two months. You can find reliable information and resources for local COVID-19 guidance from county health officials: 

LAKE: https://t.co/MiTDxMW5Jy

COOK: https://t.co/DFZrMX5iwU

Everyone can make a difference. 

Right now, we are in the middle of a massive outbreak where effectively tracing the spread of the virus will help save lives. 

Apply to be a Lake County contact tracer today:

https://t.co/3rsXayGeE3

We will beat back the virus, but only when we come together as one nation, united by the vision, character and persistence that those who came before us have always found when tested by daunting challenges.

We continue to pray for all our country, and all those tasked with leading us through these health and economic crises. May they have the wisdom and strength to rise to the moment and bring our nation relief, recovery and ultimately renewal.

As we pray for the health of all those affected by the virus around the world, let us also be reminded to take all possible precautions and follow the three Ws—Wear a mask, Wash your hands frequently, and Watch your distance (stay six feet apart).
I wish a full recovery for President Trump, the First Lady, Hope Hicks and everyone else affected by the COVID-19 outbreak within the White House.

These are the ideas that lie behind the COVID Prepare Act. This is bipartisan, commonsense, legislation, crafted with my friend John Katko to assure the American people that their federal government is fully prepared to address this ever-changing public health and economic crisis

... for beating back the virus and mitigating its impact on our health care system, on our economy and on our lives and livelihoods. We can only get to the other side of these crises with clear-eyed assessment and realistic, fact-based, science-driven solutions.

Today, the House passed my bipartisan COVID PREPARE Act on a unanimous voice vote. 

With the timeline for rolling out a safe and effective vaccine still unknown, it is imperative that the government develop and implement comprehensive strategies... https://t.co/CEGd45NNHG

The President’s decision to nominate her to the Supreme Court now defines his determination to undermine protections for Americans with pre-existing conditions and his failure to adequately focus on and address the nation’s pandemic.
Amy Coney Barrett will define the Court for a generation with her anti-healthcare, anti-choice, and pro-NRA positions.

In the middle of this pandemic, we must work to protect Latino lives, currently disproportionately affected by Covid-19. 
#HispanicHeritageMonth

It’s not too late to act, but time is working against us.

If we don’t pass legislation to build upon the CARES Act, the current economic crisis will expand into a housing crisis, a food crisis and an increasingly deadly health crisis.

This health crises is also an economic crisis that is infinitely worse than it needed to be because of President Trump’s refusal to act responsibly.  

Both the health and economic crises continue to get worse and still the President and the Senate Republicans fail to respond.

It didn’t have to be this way.  

The Trump administration’s failings in responding to the COVID-19 pandemic has already cost the country more than 150,000 lives with millions more affected by the health impacts.

https://t.co/dASWAjjg70

The Healthcare Workforce Resilience Act would reallocate 40,000 unused visas for physicians and nurses. The strong bipartisan, bicameral support for this bill shows it is a common sense response to the Covid-19 pandemic, and I urge all my colleagues to join our effort.

Immigrant nurses and doctors have long been an integral part of our health care system, and during this public health crisis, these highly trained, dedicated health professionals can make a life-saving difference.
